reviewText: My mom bought this for me as a surprise and it has 3 fires to choose from.  Holiday, Campfire and a Fireplace that reflects in the glass doors.  Very well done!
Title: The Ultimate Fireplace

reviewText: Ironically, after having been in the fireplace business for several years, I do not have a fireplace in my home.  I have missed not being able to stoke up a fire on a cold and damp day.  The Ultimate Fireplace DVD has been an amazing replacement for the real thing.  My wife and I are voracious readers so we curl up in our favorite chairs nightly with our latest books in front of the crackling fire.  We have two dogs and it is funny how they start to pant when the fireplace DVD is running.  It is so realistic that they are sure they must be getting hot.  With Christmas around the corner we put on our favorite Christmas music and the Christmas fireplace scene and our home takes on an idyllic presence with us curled up with a steaming cup of tea or hot cider and the dogs resting beside us.  Truly a Rockwell moment.
Title: The Ultimate Fireplace

reviewText: We miss our fireplace, and this is about the best we can come to experiencing a fireplace over the holidays right now. I'm glad to have it, but boy do I miss the real thing.
Title: The Ultimate Fireplace

reviewText: Let me preface this by saying that I got the DVD a couple of years ago as a joke, thinking my husband would absolutely hate it. Surprisingly enough, we both love it, as unbelievably kitschy as it is. This year, though, my husband is out to sea over the holidays, so in an unparalleled show of undying love and affection (ha), I sent it with him as a surprise. The problem? Now I don't have one. I downloaded this, and I like it, but maybe not quite as much as the DVD. With the DVD, there's the option to do an "unending fire," or just once through; crappy Cmas music (that adds to the kitsch, if possible), crackling fire, music + crackling, or silence. Also, you can choose different backgrounds/hearths. But, with the instant download, there is only the fire with the crackling. Other people have commented that it's too loud, but I play Christmas music and the video at the same time, so it's the right volume for me to still hear it without it overwhelming the music. The main feature that I miss on the DVD is the unending fire... We have a tradition of sleeping under the Christmas tree with the "fireplace" on (laugh if you must), and one of the best parts was having it still playing when I woke up in the middle of the night. So - I'll use the $8 version for this year, and in the future, we'll use the DVD.
Title: The Ultimate Fireplace

reviewText: This could have been a much better video if there wasn't some wood pieces jetting up into the airA nice traditional log fire would have made it something we would be playing from time to time.As it is, it just didn't strike the cord of realism that it might have, had the logs been lying downgetting smaller and smaller as time goes on, because they took the video and sound from a real fire.If i had the time and equipment I would do a fire like that, for people to  truly enjoy.I would also make it on a DVD disk, so it didn't have to take up room on a tivo hard drive forever.
Title: The Ultimate Fireplace

reviewText: I have given this CD to many friends and family.  I always play it at Christmas time and when it's cold outside (ha) it seems to warm up the room, even tho' you'll say that's not possible. AND, you know how messy a real fire in the hearth can be, not to mention having to clean all of the drapes and upholstery after every winter season with a real fire, so, this is a fun substitute, really! I like the crackling wood noises, too.
Title: The Ultimate Fireplace
